Pembroke_Pines.National Airlines Open Invitational: The National Airlines Open Invitational was a professional golf tournament in south Florida on the PGA Tour. It was held in late March in Hialeah at the West Course of the Country Club of Miami in 1969, 1970, and 1971. At the time, it was among the richest events on tour, with a $200,000 purse and a $40,000 winner's share.
